decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly reanimating powerful creatures from the graveyard using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Solitude while protecting the combo with cards like Force of Negation. It utilizes instant speed reanimation and flicker effects like Ephemerate to cheat creatures into play and generate value from enters-the-battlefield triggers. The deck also includes control elements like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Leyline Binding to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the strategy revolves around efficiently reanimating creatures to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory.

The deck revolves around quickly putting Allosaurus Rider onto the battlefield using cards like Neoform and Eldritch Evolution, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with Chancellor of the Annex. Using Gemstone Mine and other mana sources, the goal is to bring out powerful creatures like Ghalta, Stampede Tyrant and Xenagos, God of Revels to overwhelm the opponent. Misty Rainforest and Windswept Heath help with deck thinning and fixing mana, while Pact of Negation provides protection. Glittering Wish allows for versatility in accessing sideboard cards for various situations.

The deck focuses on resource denial and disruption, using a combination of hand disruption spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and profane tutor, along with powerful control spells like Damnation and Torment of Hailfire. The deck also utilizes a variety of land destruction spells and tutors to maximize the effectiveness of Cabal Coffers. The main goal is to slow down the opponent's game plan, disrupt their hand, and control the board until the player can establish a dominant position and win the game.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quick and aggressive gameplay, utilizing cards like Joshua, Phoenix's Dominant, Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, and Seasoned Pyromancer to pressure the opponent early on. The deck also includes disruption elements like Goblin Bombardment, Static Prison, and Thraben Charm to control the board and protect its threats. Additionally, the deck has a strong mana base with fetch lands like Flooded Strand and Arid Mesa, as well as powerful finishers like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of speed, aggression, and resilience.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells, aiming to deal damage as quickly as possible. Utilizing efficient cards like Monastery Swiftspear and Dragon's Rage Channeler, along with burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart, the deck aims to control the board and lower the opponent's life total rapidly. The deck also includes card selection spells like Preordain and Expressive Iteration to ensure consistent draws and maximize its chances of winning through fast aggression.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on utilizing creature abilities and direct damage spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. Cards like Voice of Victory and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury provide powerful creatures, while Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Goblin Bombardment offer additional damage sources. Static Prison helps to control the opponent's board, while Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Seasoned Pyromancer generate card advantage. With a mix of aggressive creatures and burn spells, this deck aims to close out games quickly and efficiently.

This deck is focused on aggressive, fast-paced gameplay with a focus on dealing direct damage to the opponent. The key strategy revolves around playing low-cost, efficient creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear, while casting spells like Lightning Bolt, Boros Charm, and Lava Spike to quickly chip away at the opponent's life total. The deck also includes some burn spells like Rift Bolt and Skewer the Critics to maintain pressure and close out the game. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of direct damage spells and aggressive creatures.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly mill out your opponent's library using cards like Hedron Crab, Ruin Crab, and Archive Trap while controlling the board with counter spells and removals like Fatal Push and Drown in the Loch. Tasha's Hideous Laughter can consistently mill a large portion of the opponent's deck in one go, while cards like Visions of Beyond help you draw more cards when your opponent's library shrinks. With efficient mill cards and disruption, this deck aims to win through deck depletion rather than traditional combat damage.
